body_html:
I get this warning during tensorflow installation:

WARNING: ~/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/BUILD:1781:1: in includes attribute of cc_library rule //tensorflow/core:framework_headers_lib: '../../external/nsync/public' resolves to 'external/nsync/public' not below the relative path of its package 'tensorflow/core'. This will be an error in the future. Since this rule was created by the macro 'cc_header_only_library', the error might have been caused by the macro implementation in ~/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow.bzl:1044:30.

Then when I run tensorflow in C++, it complains that the nsync library cannot be found, so I get and error:

/usr/local/include/google/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/platform/default/mutex.h:25:22: fatal error: nsync_cv.h: No such file or directory

body:
I get this warning during tensorflow installation:

WARNING: ~/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/BUILD:1781:1: in includes attribute of cc_library rule //tensorflow/core:framework_headers_lib: '../../external/nsync/public' resolves to 'external/nsync/public' not below the relative path of its package 'tensorflow/core'. This will be an error in the future. Since this rule was created by the macro 'cc_header_only_library', the error might have been caused by the macro implementation in ~/tensorflow/tensorflow/tensorflow.bzl:1044:30.

Then when I run tensorflow in C++, it complains that the nsync library cannot be found, so I get and error:

/usr/local/include/google/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/platform/default/mutex.h:25:22: fatal error: nsync_cv.h: No such file or directory
